      • mathIntegral

        public static double mathIntegral​(java.util.function.Function<java.lang.Double,​java.lang.Double> function,
                                  double a,
                                  double b,
                                  int rectNumber)
        This method calculates the definite integral of the function between x = b and x = a.
        Parameters:
        function - The IFunction
        a - The lower bound of the integral
        b - The higher bound of the integral
        rectNumber - Number of rectangles which will approximate the area.
        Returns:
        The definite integral between x = b and x = a.

      • mathIntegral

        public static double mathIntegral​(java.util.function.Function<java.lang.Double,​java.lang.Double> function,
                                  double a,
                                  double b)
        This method calculates the definite integral of the function between x = b and x = a, by using 10000 rectangles.
        Parameters:
        function - The IFunction
        a - The lower bound of the integral
        b - The higher bound of the integral
        Returns:
        The definite integral between x = b and x = a.
